member.summary: The Application class, representing an instance of the IdApp.

member.summary: Sends the contents of the database to support.
member.param: Name of file used to keep track of state changes.

member.name: M:IdApp.App.OpenUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Opens an URL in the application.
member.returns: If URL is processed or not.

member.name: M:IdApp.App.InputPin
member.summary: Asks the user to input its PIN. PIN is verified before being returned.
member.returns: PIN, if the user has provided the correct PIN. Empty string, if PIN is not configured, null if operation is cancelled.

member.name: M:IdApp.App.VerifyPin
member.summary: Asks the user to verify with its PIN.
member.returns: If the user has provided the correct PIN

member.summary:
A base class for all view models, inheriting from the . This class provides default implementations for the and methods. Override those to implement setup/teardown when a page/view is appearing and disappearing to/from the screen respectively.
NOTE: using this class requires your page/view to inherit from .

member.name: M:IdApp.Pages.Registration.Registration.RegistrationPage.OnAppearing
member.summary: Overridden to sync the view with the view model when the page appears on screen.

members.member: This is a hack. The issue is that the Carousel view doesn't reflect the CurrentStep binding correctly in the UI. The viewmodel is correct. The position property on the CarouselView is correct. But during restarts it still doesn't show the correct view template for that step. Instead it shows the last view template. So here we scroll back and forth one step to get it to be in sync with the viewmodel.

member.summary: Scans a QR Code, and depending on the actual result, takes different actions. This typically means navigating to an appropriate page.

member.summary: Scans a QR Code, and depending on the actual result, takes different actions. This typically means navigating to an appropriate page.

member.name: M:IdApp.Services.UI.QR.QrCode.ScanQrCode(IdApp.Services.Navigation.INavigationService,System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary:
Navigates to the Scan QR Code Page, waits for scan to complete, and returns the result. This is seemingly simple, but performs several operations, namely:
Display the
Wait for the user to scan a QR code or enter it manually, or cancel.
Navigate back to the calling page.
In order to handle processing in the correct order, you may need to use the action parameter. It is provided to do additional processing before the is navigated away from.
member.param: The navigation service to use for page navigation.
The localized name of the command to display when scanning.
The asynchronous action to invoke right after a QR Code has been scanned, but before the Scan Page closes.

member.name: M:IdApp.Services.UI.QR.QrCode.TrySetResultAndClosePage(IdApp.Services.Navigation.INavigationService,IdApp.Services.UI.IUiSerializer,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to set the Scan QR Code result and close the scan page.
member.param: The navigation service to use for page navigation.
The current UI Dispatcher to use for marshalling back to the main thread.
